<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Filter out potentially dead comdat functions where other entries keep the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// entire comdat group alive.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This is designed for cases where functions appear to become dead but remain</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// alive due to other live entries in their comdat group.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The \\p DeadComdatFunctions container should only have pointers to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// &#96;Function&#96;s which are members of a comdat group and are believed to be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// dead.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// After this routine finishes, the only remaining &#96;Function&#96;s in \\p</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// DeadComdatFunctions are those where every member of the comdat is listed</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// and thus removing them is safe (provided &#42;all&#42; are removed).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ad1d412633e05b10c6b4be309b010a13f">filterDeadComdatFunctions</a>(</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl&lt;Function &#42;&gt;</a> &amp;DeadComdatFunctions);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Produce a unique identifier for this module by taking the MD5 sum of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// the names of the module&#39;s strong external symbols that are not comdat</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// members.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This identifier is normally guaranteed to be unique, or the program would</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// fail to link due to multiply defined symbols.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="128"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="129"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// If the module has no strong external symbols (such a module may still have a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// semantic effect if it performs global initialization), we cannot produce a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// unique identifier for this module, so we return the empty string.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132"><span class="doxyHighlight">std::string <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a6b8599f07b1b0181899c650b7b385b26">getUniqueModuleId</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/module">Module</a> &#42;M);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Embed the memory buffer \\p Buf into the module \\p M as a global using the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// specified section name. Also provide a metadata entry to identify it in the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// module using the same section name.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ae744a53dbb2720e5678fb879156761e9">embedBufferInModule</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/module">Module</a> &amp;M, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorybufferref">MemoryBufferRef</a> Buf, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/sectionname">SectionName</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="138"><span class="doxyHighlight">                         <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/align">Align</a> Alignment = <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/align">Align</a>(1));</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="139"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="140"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Lower all calls to ifuncs by replacing uses with indirect calls loaded out</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="141"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// of a global table initialized in a global constructor. This will introduce</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="142"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// one constructor function and adds it to llvm.global&#95;ctors. The constructor</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="143"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// will call the resolver function once for each ifunc.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="144"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="145"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Leaves any unhandled constant initializer uses as-is.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="146"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="147"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// If \\p IFuncsToLower is empty, all ifuncs in the module will be lowered.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="148"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// If \\p IFuncsToLower is non-empty, only the selected ifuncs will be lowered.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="149"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="150"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The processed ifuncs without remaining users will be removed from the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="151"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// module.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="152"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ae819b62ec706cb229654ea5fb6553501">lowerGlobalIFuncUsersAsGlobalCtor</a>(</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="153"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/module">Module</a> &amp;M, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef&lt;GlobalIFunc &#42;&gt;</a> IFuncsToLower = &#123;&#125;);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="154"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="155"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125; </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// End llvm namespace</span></CodeLine>
